title: Oxfordshire Live: Monday 27 March - BBC News
summary: pregnant women are facing journeys of more than 90 minutes from banbury to oxford to give birth , according to victoria prentis mp .
£ 1m to be spent on regenerating berinsfield .
cost of inactivity in oxfordshire estimated to be £ 14.5m a year .
oxford united 's manager says he wo n't be a weakened side against bury tomorrow ahead of sunday 's efl trophy final .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for reading today , we 'll be back with more news , sport , weather and travel from across the county from 08:00 tomorrow .
author: Joe Nimmo
BBC South

documents.title: oxford takes a look at the new pound coin
text: oxford takes a look at the new pound coin

documents.title: banbury north signal box demolished despite bid to save it
text: a century-old signal box has been demolished despite a campaign by railway enthusiasts to save it .
the oxfordshire box , dating from 1901 , was reduced to rubble overnight as campaigners watched from a bridge .
one protester said former signalmen would be `` turning in their graves '' , while another described the flattened banbury north box as a `` crime scene '' .
network rail said it was replacing more than 800 remaining signal boxes with 12 regional operating centres ( rocs ) .

documents.title: travel update : slow traffic in henley-on-thames
text: in henley-on-thames drivers should expect delays of about 25 minutes through temporary traffic lights on bridge street from white hill and to the a321 .
it 's also very slow on wargrave road .
author: Al Ryan
BBC Oxford travel presenter

documents.title: thames valley police launches app
text: thames valley police has today launched its first-ever mobile app to the public .
the thames valley alert app , which is available now for free on android and iphone , delivers the latest local policing news to mobile devices and instantly notifies users when a message is sent .

documents.title: oxford explosion : six residents still without permanent homes
text: housing association a2dominion has said six people have not yet been permanently rehomed after an explosion which destroyed a block of flats and killed a man in gibbs crescent , oxford .
housing director dawn wightman said : all residents who have been unable to return to their homes have been offered permanent alternative homes .
`` whilst some residents have accepted a new home , there are six residents who have not felt able to accept the properties offered to them .
we are continuing to work with these residents and oxford city council to find a suitable home for them . ''

documents.title: gps practices merge
text: kennington practice is merging with botley practice on 1 april 2017 .
it will remain as a branch surgery of botley
an update from the practice said doctors , nurses , and staff from both teams are working together to ensure things run smoothly .

documents.title: pilot will see inpatient beds go
text: all inpatient beds at thame community hospital are to temporarily go as part of a health pilot .
new community hubs are being launched at thame and marlow community hospitals next month as part of plans to provide more care closer to home .
the space previously occupied by the beds will be used to provide frailty assessment clinics at the hospitals .
thame community hospital currently has eight inpatient beds .
buckinghamshire healthcare nhs trust says the new service will benefit more than 350 patients , and is part of their plans to invest £ 1m to expand community services .

documents.title: cost of inactivity
text: inactivity costs oxfordshire around £ 14.5m each year , according to the national institute for health and care excellence .
it says the county is one of the most active areas in england - but despite this , around 22 % of people in oxfordshire are still classified as physically inactive .

documents.title: local papers : stadium battle 'goes into overdrive '
text: multiple prospective operators are interested in bringing oxford stadium back to life , according to reports in today 's oxford mail .
today 's front - stadium battle hots up as multiple bidders line up .
plus , special report from the # ox5run
author: Oxford Mail

documents.title: where has the sunshine gone ?
text: it 's supposed to be a sunny afternoon once the cloud clears not much sign of it yet .

documents.title: no rests before wembley
text: oxford united manager michael appleton says he will not be fielding a weakened side against bury tomorrow .
the us are preparing to face coventry in the efl trophy final at wembley on sunday , but first they play bury at the kassam stadium in league 2 .
i think we 've got to be professional and have got to try win the game as best as we possibly can we 'll as strong a side as we possibly can on tuesday .

documents.title: helicopter crash investigated
text: the air accidents investigation branch has confirmed it is investigating a helicopter crash in south oxfordshire .
the aircraft came down on the banks of the river thames near mapledurham on friday .
neither the pilot or passenger were injured .
eyewitness luke howroyd - who took this photo - said he saw it spin out of control and land with a thud .

documents.title: mp 's anger at maternity travel times
text: mp 's anger at maternity travel times

documents.title: keep on walking !
text: radio oxford 's 'move it ' campaign is now in its third week !
it 's about finding ways of becoming active which do n't necessarily involve joining gyms and extreme exercise regimes .
david prever 's breakfast club is trying to log 10 million steps .
people have been using apps , or pedometers , to count their steps before texing them in to add to the grand total - which now stands at 5,075,350
author: BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: by-election for barton and sandhills
text: a by-election has been announced by oxford city council following the death of labour councillor van coulter .
he represented the ward of barton and sandhills .
it will be held on 4 may 2017 , the same day as the oxfordshire county council elections .

documents.title: oxfordshire 's big picture
text: oxfordshire 's big picture

documents.title: funding boost for berinsfield
text: £ 1m is to be spent on plans to regenerate berinsfield .
the government money will help pay for design work which will support a planning application .
it is part of the berinsfield community investment scheme , which aims to balance the need for new homes with demand for improved facilities in the village .
this funding is a major boost for the regeneration project and for everyone 's ambitions for the area .
we 've been working very positively with the local community to help ensure we can meet the needs for existing and future residents .

documents.title: sunny spells and light winds
text: sunny spells and light winds

documents.title: mps survey highlights hospital travel times
text: some pregnant women in north oxfordshire have to travel for more than 90 minutes to give birth according to an mp .
it 's after conservative mp for banbury , victoria prentis , asked people to send her their travel times .
she said journeys from the banbury area to oxford 's hospital take around one hour and 40 minutes , on average .
oxfordshire clinical commissioning group said the results will be `` considered alongside other feedback '' .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to oxfordshire live on monday 27 march .
if the thought of returning to your desk is filling you will existential dread , it 's at least expected to be another warm , sunny , spring day .
and if you want to know what 's going on across the county , we 'll be here until 18:00 bst with latest .
thank you to tim turan who sent us this photo of vapour trails in the sky over oxfordshire yesterday .
